result.execSummary:
All charges against Marvin Edward Flint Jr. in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marvin Edward Flint Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Edward Flint Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:Review Hearing/Dismissed 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.
08:45 AM Defendant Marvin Edward Flint not in court.  David S Olson appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom video. Defendant is no longer at the Rock County Jail. Matter is dismissed.
Review hearing on March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:13 PM Defendant Marvin Edward Flint in court, in custody by zoom video.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Defendant waives right to attorney, court finds the defendant waives right to attorney freely and voluntarily. Defendant waives right to extradition. Defendant signs waiver of extradition in open court. Bond is revoked.  Review hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Activity:Extradition Hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.
Extradition hearing on March 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Activity:Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:24 PM Defendant Marvin Edward Flint in court by video in custody with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  David S Olson and Margaret Ginocchio  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $5000 set. Matter to be set.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
